whyClientsChoose.name: Why Clients Choose Korn Ferry
whyClientsChoose.description: This analysis identifies key themes explaining why clients choose Korn Ferry, focusing on positive factors, competitive advantages, and selection criteria.

themes.label: Trusted Relationships and Expertise
themes.description: Clients value long-standing relationships and trust in individual consultants, which drive repeat engagements and confidence in Korn Ferry's ability to deliver.

supportingQuotes.text: I tend to go to Korn Ferry because I actually like the people... they know me, I haven't got to be on my best behaviour when I talk.
supportingQuotes.interviewId: Paul Lester, Hudson Advisors UK Ltd.

supportingQuotes.text: Anywhere Chris went, I would go.

interviewIds: Paul Lester, Hudson Advisors UK Ltd.
Dr. Jan Stefan Scheld, Boehringer Ingelheim
Lesley Dwyer, Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital

themes.label: High-Quality Candidate Delivery
themes.description: Clients appreciate Korn Ferry's ability to deliver high-quality candidates that meet role requirements and align with organizational culture.

supportingQuotes.text: They absolutely understood the brief, really fully targeted exactly the right people, put a great long list together, managed the candidates really, really well.
They were very successful in finding the right candidate to meet our needs.

interviewIds: Claire Van Coberen, ASML Netherlands BV

themes.label: Responsive and Proactive Communication
themes.description: Clients value Korn Ferry's consistent, proactive communication and structured updates, which keep them informed and engaged throughout the process.

supportingQuotes.text: We had one scheduled weekly call throughout the process... and they were always available for other queries, more ad hoc stuff.
Greg scheduled by monthly calls with the team... to give us updates, to share... additional context on the candidates... and help answer any questions.

interviewIds: Lesley Dwyer, Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital
Claire Van Coberen, ASML Netherlands BV

themes.label: Flexibility and Adaptability
themes.description: Korn Ferry's flexibility in adapting to client needs, including commercial terms and engagement models, is highly valued by clients.

supportingQuotes.text: Korn Ferry has been very good about working with us on those...It's that fine balance... and Korn Ferry has been very good about providing the flexibility that we need.

Korn Ferry have terms and conditions they absolutely have to meet, but I've really appreciated the flexibility, whether it's different aspects of the retainer versus the overall fee, or how we structure the overall fee.

interviewIds: Lesley Dwyer, Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital

themes.label: Deep Market and Cultural Understanding
themes.description: Clients choose Korn Ferry for their deep understanding of specific markets and organizational cultures, which enhances candidate alignment and process efficiency.

supportingQuotes.text: They knew our business, they knew the nuts and bolts of our business, and they also understood the culture that we had.
They understood that we are a membership organisation that lobbies on behalf of our members... they had the right people in the room.

interviewIds: Lesley Dwyer, Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital
Dr. Jan Stefan Scheld, Boehringer Ingelheim

promoterExperience.name: The Promoter Experience
promoterExperience.description: This theme category explores the key factors that contribute to exceptional experiences and strong satisfaction among promoters working with Korn Ferry, focusing on what they value most.

themes.label: Trusted Relationships and Continuity
themes.description: Promoters value long-standing, trust-based relationships with individual consultants, which drive their continued engagement with Korn Ferry.

supportingQuotes.text: I tend to go to Korn Ferry because I actually like the people... they know me, I haven't got to be on my best behaviour when I talk.
Anywhere Chris went, I would go.

themes.label: High-Quality Candidate Delivery
themes.description: Promoters appreciate the consistent delivery of high-caliber candidates that align well with their organizational needs.

supportingQuotes.text: They were very successful in finding the right candidate to meet our needs.
The candidate quality repeatedly exceeded expectations.

themes.label: Responsive and Proactive Communication
themes.description: Promoters value Korn Ferry's consistent, proactive communication and structured updates that keep them informed throughout the process.

supportingQuotes.text: Communication is always absolutely stand out... we are in regular communication with Hilary and the team on the project.
Greg scheduled by monthly calls with the team... to give us updates, to share... additional context on the candidates.

themes.label: Flexibility and Adaptability
themes.description: Promoters appreciate Korn Ferry's flexibility in adapting to their specific needs and constraints, whether in terms of engagement approach or commercial terms.

supportingQuotes.text: Korn Ferry has been very good about working with us on those... It's that fine balance... and Korn Ferry has been very good about providing the flexibility that we need.
Korn Ferry have terms and conditions they absolutely have to meet, but I've really appreciated the flexibility.

themes.label: Deep Market and Subject Matter Expertise
themes.description: Promoters value Korn Ferry's deep understanding of their industry and the specific roles they are hiring for, which enhances the relevance and quality of candidate searches.

supportingQuotes.text: They knew our business, they knew the nuts and bolts of our business, and they also understood the culture that we had.
She actually has an investment risk background. She understood the role, the needs, and was able to find someone with that type of background.

whereFallsShort.name: Where the Experience Falls Short
whereFallsShort.description: This category identifies themes where Korn Ferry's experience falls short, focusing on challenges, pain points, gaps, and areas for improvement mentioned by detractors and passives.

themes.label: Diversity and Inclusion Gaps
themes.description: Challenges in presenting diverse candidate slates and ensuring gender diversity in consulting teams.

supportingQuotes.text: We had to remind the guys a number of times that we want to see women as well as men.
All the consultants from Korn Ferry were all men... it didn't really sit very well.

themes.label: Compensation and Offer Management
themes.description: Difficulties in obtaining accurate compensation information and managing offer negotiations effectively.

supportingQuotes.text: Trying to get out of them what current comp was, was impossible.
They kept having to go back and forth... it took forever to put an offer together.
I would have expected a little bit more of support... I would have appreciated a little bit more of challenging behaviour versus the candidate.

themes.label: Communication and Coordination Issues
themes.description: Instances of poor communication, late report delivery, and lack of coordination affecting client confidence.

supportingQuotes.text: The reports would often land an hour or two before the call... you have no hope in hell of getting to it.
Early on, it was a little confusing... several different people... reaching out... we couldn't search for [emails] easily.
There was a bit of a feeling of lagging.
It was obvious to see that there was a bit of frustration.

themes.label: Candidate Quality and Sourcing
themes.description: Concerns about the quality and breadth of candidate sourcing, particularly in high-profile or complex searches.

supportingQuotes.text: They didn't really generate the level of the candidates that we thought they should have.
There weren't really people who weren't on our radar that made you think, wow, that's amazing.

themes.label: Process and System Gaps
themes.description: Operational and systemic issues affecting the quality of delivery and client trust.

supportingQuotes.text: It was just always like 'Oh, we're so sorry that happened, but I was in the meeting.'
Then it makes you start to question everything else. Are they going to get the contract right?
